content.question: Which of the following graphs best predicts the solar energy output in the country in the Northern Hemisphere in December?

choices.label: The figure presents a bar graph. The horizontal axis indicates the time of day, from 12:00 A M through 10:00 P M, in increments of 2 hours. The vertical axis is labeled Gigawatts, and the numbers 0 through 25, in increments of 5, are indicated. The data for the bar graph are as follows. Note that all values are approximate. 12:00 A M, 0 gigawatts. 2:00 A M, 0 gigawatts. 4:00 A M, 0 gigawatts. 5:00 A M, 1 gigawatt. 6:00 A M, 2 gigawatts. 7:00 A M, 3 gigawatts. 8:00 A M, 4 gigawatts. 9:00 A M, 6 gigawatts. 10:00 A M, 11 gigawatts. 11:00 A M, 17 gigawatts. 12:00 P M, 23 gigawatts. 1:00 P M, 24 gigawatts. 2:00 P M, 23 gigawatts. 3:00 P M, 17 gigawatts. 4:00 P M, 11 gigawatts. 5:00 P M, 6 gigawatts. 6:00 P M, 4 gigawatts. 7:00 P M, 3 gigawatts. 8:00 P M, 2 gigawatts. 9:00 P M, 1 gigawatt. 10:00 P M, 0 gigawatts.

skill.text: Skill 5.C: Explain patterns and trends in data to draw conclusions.
